fr.upmc.components.examples.basic_cs.ports

Class URIProviderInboundPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.upmc.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
            • fr.upmc.components.examples.basic_cs.ports.URIProviderInboundPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    URIProviderI, ComponentImplementedI, OfferedI, InboundPortI, PortI, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class URIProviderInboundPort
extends AbstractInboundPort
implements URIProviderI
    The class URIProviderInboundPort defines the inbound port exposing the interface URIProviderI for components of type URIProvider.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 22 janv. 2014

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • URIProviderInboundPort

        public URIProviderInboundPort(java.lang.String uri,
                      ComponentI owner)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        create the port under some given URI and for a given owner. The constructor for AbstractInboundPort requires the interface that the port is implementing as an instance of java.lang.CLass, but this is statically known so the constructor does not need to receive the information as parameter.

        Contract

         pre    uri != null && owner instanceof URIProvider
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        uri - uri under which the port will be published.
        owner - component owning the port.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • provideURI

        public java.lang.String provideURI()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        calls the service method of the owner object by executing a task using one of the component's threads.

        Contract

         pre    true                            // no more preconditions.
 post   true                            // no more postconditions.
        Specified by:
        provideURI in interface URIProviderI
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        URIProviderI.provideURI()
